Package com.eclipsesource.tabris.widgets

Class PagingIndicator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget
      • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control
        • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Scrollable
          • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite
            • com.eclipsesource.tabris.widgets.PagingIndicator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, org.eclipse.rap.rwt.Adaptable, org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Drawable, org.eclipse.swt.internal.SerializableCompatibility
    public class PagingIndicator
extends org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite

    When you build your app with a paging concept using Swipe, TabrisUI or any homebrew solution itâ€™s sometimes required that you need to indicate the paging progress. This is often done using colored bullets. With the PagingIndicator you can create such bullets. It allows you to define the number of bullets, the active one and the look and feel.

    The PagingIndicator is a stand alone Widget. It needs to be part of your layout.

    Since:
    1.3
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • PagingIndicator

        public PagingIndicator​(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent)

        Creates a new PagingIndicator with the provided parent. Default values are:

        • bullet count = 1
        • active bullet index = 0
        • spacing between bullets = 9px
        • bullet diameter = 7px
        • active color = blue
        • inactive color = gray
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent to use. Must not be null.

    • Method Detail

        public void setActive​(int index)

        Marks the bullet with the defined index as active.

        Parameters:
        index - the index of the bullet to become active. Must be >= 0.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when the defined index does not exist.
